meanings.definition: To oppress or harass someone because of their beliefs or identity.
meanings.sent1: The cruel ruler would persecute anyone who disagreed with him.
meanings.sent2: The government should not persecute people for their religious beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The bully tried to persecute the new student for being different.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed to persecute the small town with never-ending rain.
meanings.sent5: The relentless heat seemed to persecute the weary travelers on their journey.

meanings.definition: To pursue with harassing or oppressive treatment.
meanings.sent1: The paparazzi would persecute the celebrity wherever she went.
meanings.sent2: The detective vowed to persecute the criminal until justice was served.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat seemed to persecute the poor mouse all day.
meanings.sent4: The haunting memories seemed to persecute him in his dreams.
meanings.sent5: The persistent alarm clock seemed to persecute her every morning.

meanings.definition: To subject someone to hostility or ill-treatment, especially because of their race or religion.
meanings.sent1: The discriminatory laws were used to persecute certain groups in society.
meanings.sent2: History has shown how easily people can persecute others based on differences.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous ghost liked to persecute the residents of the old mansion.
meanings.sent4: The shadows seemed to persecute the lonely figure walking down the dimly lit street.
meanings.sent5: The relentless waves seemed to persecute the fragile sandcastle on the beach.
